results.title: The Autonomic nervous system
results.brief_description: Extraordinary photographs of living organs shows the autonomic nervous system controlling involuntary body processes such as breathing, heart rate, blood pressure and digestion. Animation is used to illustrate the sympathetic and parasympathetic divisions of the autonomic nervous system and the part it is thought to play in the human emotions. No other credits available.

results.title: The Automated mariner
results.creator_credit: Roger Lupton, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how radar, sonar, and echosound are used to catch the variety of edible sealife found around the coast of Tasmania. Narrated by Frank Bansel, music performed by the Tasmanian Symphony Orchestra conducted by Pinchas Steinberg.

results.title: The Austrian Tyrol
results.brief_description: Famed for its natural beauty and alpine grandeur, the Austrian Tyrol has excellent mountain roads for enjoyable walks or mountain climbing. The film shows some of the villages including the 700 years old city of Innsbruck nestling below the vast mountains.

results.title: The Australian plague locust
results.creator_credit: Howard Hughes, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Department of Agriculture Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Australian Plague Locust, unique to Australia, is one of the major pests which attack crops, particularly in New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia. Discusses the characteristics of the locust, the reasons for plagues, and the efforts to predict and control outbreaks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Howard Hughes, Broken Hill Proprietary Company and Department of Agriculture Film Unit

results.title: The Australian Outward Bound School
results.brief_description: The Outward Bound School on the Hawkesbury River is attended by young men of various backgrounds, from all parts of Australia and Papua New Guinea. Here they share many adventures - bushwalking, rock climbing and boating. Before participating in any expeditions they learn the fundamentals of map and compass reading, first aid and safety. The course is designed to teach self-discipline, give confidence, a sense of responsibility and achievement. Wholehearted participation in all activities prepares the boys to take their places in the community always remembering the Outward Bound motto - “To serve, to strive, and not to yield”. No credits available - donated by the Shell Company of Australia.

results.title: The Australian littering quest
results.creator_credit: Jack Zalkalns, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A satirical look at the four contestants hopeful of winning Australia’s littering quest. Describes the various ways they do their littering - including leaving rubbish at a picnic, throwing out “throw-away litter bags”. The judge, a computer, comments on their achievements and announces the winner. Cast includes Tom Paine, Pauline David, Rod Bryer, Guy Doro-Sainter, Monika Tokarski, Ema Ganet.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack Zalkalns, Damien Parer and Tasmanian Film Corporation

results.title: The Australian impressionists 1888-1896
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
A look at paintings by Australian impressionists - A Holiday at Mentone: Charles Conder (1888). The Breakaway: Tom Roberts (1890-91). Fire’s On, Lapstone Tunnel: Arthur Streeton (1891). Moonrise, Templestowe: David Davies (1894). On the Wallaby Track: Frederick McCubbin (1896).
